sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"忍受"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: stand, bear, endure, tolerate, suffer, abide, withstand
means: stand ： 口语用词，常可与bear换用，但前者侧重指经受得起，后者强调容忍，是普通用语。
endure ： 书面用词，指长时间忍受痛苦和不幸，着重体力或意志力的坚强不屈服。
tolerate ： 指以自我克制的态度，对待令人反感或厌恶的东西，含默认宽容意味。
suffer ： 通常指非自愿或被迫忍受各种痛苦、困难或不快，强调受到苦难。
abide ： 指忍受长期的痛苦或折磨，强调耐心和屈从。多用于否定句和疑问句中。
withstand ： 指因具有一定实力、权力或能力而能忍受某种情况。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"经历，经受，遭受"之意。
means: undergo ： 多指经受艰难、痛苦、不愉快或危险等事。
experience ： 指亲身经受或体验某事。
sustain ： 指遭受痛苦或承受负担。
suffer常可与sustain通用，尤指受到损害或伤害。

sentence.Network_en: Those who suffer from narcissism become self-absorbed or chronic show-offs.
sentence.Network_cn: 被自恋症折磨的人会变得只专注于自己的事情，或者不断地自我炫耀。

sentence.Network_en: If climate changes continue, we will suffer the consequences.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果气候变化继续下去，我们将自食其果。

sentence.Network_en: Of course, the British will suffer such daily stresses patiently.
sentence.Network_cn: 当然，英国人将会耐心地承受这些日常压力。

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... sufficient 足够的 suffer 受苦 suffix 后缀.

jx.jx_en_mean: be impatient or intolerant towards people one regards as foolish or unintelligent
jx.jx_cn_mean: 对蠢人没有耐心，无法忍受蠢人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French suffrir, from Latin sufferre, from sub- 'from below' + ferre 'to bear'

entry.tran: 遭受，经受(疼痛);感到(痛苦)
entry.def: If you suffer pain, you feel it in your body or in your mind.

example.ex: Within a few days she had become seriously ill, suffering great pain and discomfort...
example.tran: 几天的时间，她就病得很严重了，疼痛难忍，周身不舒服。

example.ex: Can you assure me that my father is not suffering?
example.tran: 你能保证我父亲不会受罪吗？

entry.tran: (因疾病或处于其他不利境地而)受苦，受难，受折磨
entry.def: If you suffer from an illness or from some other bad condition, you are badly affected by it.

example.ex: He was eventually diagnosed as suffering from terminal cancer...
example.tran: 他最终被诊断出患了晚期癌症。

example.ex: I realized he was suffering from shock.

entry.tran: 遭遇，遭受，蒙受(不好的事)
entry.def: If you suffer something bad, you are in a situation in which something painful, harmful, or very unpleasant happens to you.

example.ex: The peace process has suffered a serious blow now...
example.tran: 现在和平进程遭到重创。

example.ex: Romania suffered another setback in its efforts to obtain financial support for its reforms.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚在为其改革努力寻求经济援助时再次受挫。

entry.def: If you suffer, you are badly affected by an event or situation.

example.ex: There are few who have not suffered...
It is obvious that Syria will suffer most from this change of heart.
example.tran: 很明显，这一态度的转变对叙利亚的影响最大。

entry.tran: (因不够关注或处于不利境况而)失利，失败，不成功
entry.def: If something suffers, it does not succeed because it has not been given enough attention or is in a bad situation.

example.ex: I'm not surprised that your studies are suffering...
example.tran: 你的功课变得越来越差，我并不感到奇怪。

example.ex: Without a major boost in tourism, the economy will suffer even further.
example.tran: 旅游业如果没有大的起色，经济状况会每况愈下。

entry.def: If you do not suffer fools gladly, you are not patient with people who you think are stupid.

example.ex: She doesn't suffer fools gladly and, in her view, most people are fools.
example.tran: 她不愿与笨人为伍，而在她看来，大多数人都是笨人。

sentences.sentence: "She suffered a fracture in the accident"
"He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars"
"She got a bruise on her leg"
"He got his arm broken in the scuffle"
"Every time her husband gets drunk, she suffers"

means.word_mean: 4. put up with something or somebody unpleasant;

sentences.sentence: "The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks"
"She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage"

means.word_mean: 6. feel pain or be in pain

sentences.sentence: "She is suffering from the hot weather"
"She suffers from a tendency to talk too much"

auth_sentence.content: So why do some suffer and others do not?
auth_sentence.res_content: So why do some suffer and others do not?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So why do some suffer and others do not?

auth_sentence.content: Joe and Johnny both suffer from male pattern baldness.
auth_sentence.res_content: Joe and Johnny both suffer from male pattern baldness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Joe and Johnny both suffer from male pattern baldness.

auth_sentence.content: We are not the only place to suffer theft.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are not the only place to suffer theft.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are not the only place to suffer theft.

Sentence.sentence: Other industries have suffered even more.
They want their patients to suffer less.
For those who have suffered failures in business, Steve Jobs's life experience serves as.
They suffer great losses in stocks, property and other assets.
Milkman says, "that these extracurricular jobs were an effort on the part of the workers to regain their dignity after suffering the degradation of repetitive assembly line work in the factory.
Most pop singers suffer from three things: lack of training, overuse and abuse of the voice, especially when they are young.

means.word_mean: 受痛苦; 受损害; （因疾病、痛苦、悲伤等）受苦, 受难, 受折磨

sentences.en: I'll make you suffer for this insolence.
sentences.cn: 我会因你无礼而使你受苦的。

sentences.en: She suffered greatly as a child.

sentences.cn: 他不能忍受别人批评他。

sentences.en: He suffered nobody to touch his flower.
sentences.cn: 他不允许任何人碰他的花。

sentences.en: The prisoner was not suffered to say a word.
He suffered the humiliation of being forced to resign.
sentences.cn: 他蒙受了被迫辞职的羞辱。

jushi.english: The great majority of the women there suffered in the same way.
jushi.chinese: 那儿大多数妇女都受过同样的苦。

jushi.english: His business suffered greatly during the war.
jushi.chinese: 战争期间他的业务受到巨大的损失。

jushi.english: He was afraid his reputation would suffer because of that.
jushi.chinese: 他担心,他的声誉会因此受到损害。
